question_answer_pairs.question: How will the Appointing Authority for the posts be determined?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Appointing Authority for the posts will be as per Rules/Regulations i.e. AIIMS Rules, 1958 and AIIMS Regulations 1999 as applicable.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the process for Probation, NOC Verification of character and antecedents, caste category etc
question_answer_pairs.answer: Probation, NOC Verification of character and antecedents, caste category etc. shall be made applicable by the Institute to the recruitment process.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the process if the Committee for Selection considers it appropriate to recommend engaging a person on contractual basis?
question_answer_pairs.answer: In case the Committee for Selection considers it appropriate to recommend engaging a person on contractual basis, the same may be recommended only against a regular, sanctioned and unfilled post. question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the interim board selected by the applicants for the registration of a multi-state cooperative society?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The interim board selected by the applicants for the registration of a multi-state cooperative society shall hold office till the regular board is elected.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How much notice is required for calling an annual general meeting of a multi-state cooperative society?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Annual general meeting of a multi-state cooperative society may be called by giving not less than fourteen days notice in writing.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How much notice is required for calling a special general meeting of a multi-state cooperative society?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Special general meeting of a multi-state cooperative society may be called by giving not less than seven days notice in writing.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who can determine the period of notice, time, place, and subjects to be considered in a general meeting called by the Central Registrar or any person authorized by him?
question_answer_pairs.answer: When a general meeting is called by the Central Registrar or any person authorized by him, he may determine the period of notice, time and place of such meeting, and the subjects to be considered in such meeting.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who can preside over a general meeting called by the Central Registrar or any person authorized by him?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Central Registrar or any person authorized by him may preside over such general meeting.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What information should the notice of annual general meeting be accompanied by?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The notice of annual general meeting shall be accompanied by a copy each of the audited balance sheet, profit and loss account, together with the auditor's report thereon relating to the preceding year and the report of the board, amendment of bye-laws, if any and election of members of the board, if any.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the quorum required for a general meeting of a multi-state cooperative society?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Unless otherwise provided in the bye-laws, the quorum for a general meeting shall be one-fifth of the total number of members of the general body of a multi-state cooperative society.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Can business be transacted at a general meeting without a quorum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: No business shall be transacted at any general meeting unless there is a quorum at the time when the business of the meeting is due to commence.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What happens if a quorum is not present within half-an-hour from the time appointed for the meeting?
question_answer_pairs.answer: If within half-an-hour from the time appointed for the meeting a quorum is not present, the meeting shall stand adjourned.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Can a meeting that has been called on requisition of the members be adjourned or dissolved?
question_answer_pairs.answer: PROVIDED that a meeting which has been called on requisition of the members shall not be adjourned or dissolved.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What happens if a sufficient number of members are present during the meeting?
question_answer_pairs.answer: If at any time during the meeting sufficient number of members are present, the meeting may proceed.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Can a special general meeting be called by giving less than seven days notice?
question_answer_pairs.answer: No, special general meeting of a multi-state cooperative society may be called by giving not less than seven days notice in writing.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who can determine the subjects to be considered in a general meeting called by the Central Registrar or any person authorized by him?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Central Registrar or any person authorized by him may determine the subjects to be considered in such general meeting.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The notice of annual general meeting shall be accompanied by the auditor's report thereon relating to the preceding year and the report of the board.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: Section 16 of the CGST Act lays down the eligibility and conditions for taking input tax credit, whereas, section 17 of the CGST Act provides for apportionment of credit and blocked credits under circumstances specified therein. question_answer_pairs.question: What is the requirement for a person to be qualified for appointment as an auditor of a multi-state cooperative society?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The person must be a chartered accountant within the meaning of the Chartered Accountants Act 1949.\n\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Which persons shall not be qualified for appointment as auditor of a multi-state cooperative society?
question_answer_pairs.answer: A body corporate, an officer or employee of the multi-state cooperative society, a person who is a member or in the employment of an officer or employee of the multi-state cooperative society, and a person who is indebted to the multi-state cooperative society or has given any guarantee or provided any security in connection with the indebtedness of any third person to the multi-state cooperative society for an amount exceeding one thousand rupees.\n\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the right of every auditor of a multi-state cooperative society with respect to the books, accounts, and vouchers of the society?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Every auditor shall have a right of access at all times to the books, accounts, and vouchers of the multi-state cooperative society, whether kept at the head office of the multi-state cooperative society or elsewhere.\n\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the requirement for a person to be disqualified for appointment as an auditor of a multi-state cooperative society?
question_answer_pairs.answer: A person shall also not be qualified for appointment as an auditor of a multi-state cooperative society if he is, by virtue of sub-section (2), disqualified for appointment as an auditor of any other body corporate or multi-state cooperative society.\n\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the requirement for an auditor to vacate his office if he becomes subject to any of the disqualifications specified in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: If an auditor becomes subject, after his appointment, to any of the disqualifications specified in sub-sections (2) and (3), he shall be deemed to have vacated his office as such.\n\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the requirement for the multi-state cooperative society to send a copy of the representation to every member of the society when notice of the meeting is sent?

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the requirement for a person to be qualified for appointment as an auditor of a multi-state cooperative society?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The person must be a chartered accountant within the meaning of the Chartered Accountants Act 1949.\n\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Which persons shall not be qualified for appointment as auditor of a multi-state cooperative society?
question_answer_pairs.answer: A body corporate, an officer or employee of the multi-state cooperative society, a person who is a member or in the employment of an officer or employee of the multi-state cooperative society, and a person who is indebted to the multi-state cooperative society or has given any guarantee or provided any security in connection with the indebtedness of any third person to the multi-state cooperative society for an amount exceeding one thousand rupees.\n\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the right of every auditor of a multi-state cooperative society with respect to the books, accounts, and vouchers of the society?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Every auditor shall have a right of access at all times to the books, accounts, and vouchers of the multi-state cooperative society, whether kept at the head office of the multi-state cooperative society or elsewhere.\n\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the requirement for a person to be disqualified for appointment as an auditor of a multi-state cooperative society?
question_answer_pairs.answer: A person shall also not be qualified for appointment as an auditor of a multi-state cooperative society if he is, by virtue of sub-section (2), disqualified for appointment as an auditor of any other body corporate or multi-state cooperative society or cooperative society.\n\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the requirement for an auditor to vacate his office if he becomes subject to any of the disqualifications specified in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: If an auditor becomes subject, after his appointment, to any of the disqualifications specified in sub-sections (2) and (3), he shall be deemed to have vacated his office as such.\n\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the title of the document?

question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular number is 55/2019.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the date range mentioned in the document?

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of this circular is to provide measures to prevent dosing errors with methotrexate.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is methotrexate used for?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Methotrexate is used for treating both inflammatory diseases and cancers.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the risk associated with methotrexate-containing medicines?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The risk of dosing errors with methotrexate-containing medicines is well known.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What did the PRAC (Pharmacovigilance Risk Assessment Committee) examine?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The PRAC examined the available evidence and recommended additional measures to reduce dosing errors.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who can prescribe methotrexate-containing medicines?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Only doctors with expertise in using methotrexate-containing medicines can prescribe them.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What should healthcare professionals do to ensure patients can follow the once-weekly dosing schedule?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Healthcare professionals should ensure that patients or carers are able to follow the once-weekly dosing schedule.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What should be done with the dose recommendations to split the dose?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The dose recommendations to split the dose should be deleted from the product information for the tablet formulation.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How should the packaging for all methotrexate-containing medicines be used?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Packaging for all methotrexate-containing medicines for once-weekly use to include a prominent reminder of how the medicine should be used.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What should be provided with oral medicines?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Patient card emphasizing the weekly dosing for inflammatory diseases to be provided with oral medicines.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What should be provided to healthcare professionals?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Healthcare professionals to be provided with educational materials for oral medicines and to counsel patients accordingly.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the name of the organization that issued this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The organization that issued this circular is the Directorate General of Pharmaceutical Affairs and Drug Control, Ministry of Health, Sultanate of Oman.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the measures mentioned in the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The measures are intended to prevent dosing errors with methotrexate-containing medicines.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What type of dosing errors have led to some patients incorrectly taking methotrexate-containing medicines daily instead of weekly?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The dosing errors have led to patients taking the medicines daily instead of weekly.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the new measures included in this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The new measures include restricting who can prescribe these medicines, making warnings on the packaging more prominent, and providing educational materials for patients and healthcare professionals.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the reason for the higher dosage needed when using methotrexate for some types of cancer?
question_answer_pairs.answer: When used for some types of cancer, a much higher dosage is needed, and the medicine is taken more frequently.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are some of the consequences of dosing errors with methotrexate?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Mistakes in prescribing or dispensing methotrexate, as well as misunderstandings of the dosing schedule, have led to patients taking the medicine daily instead of weekly for inflammatory diseases, with serious consequences, including fatalities.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the PRAC and what did they do?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The PRAC is the EMA's safety committee, and they examined the available evidence and recommended additional measures to reduce dosing errors.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the measures agreed to after consultation with patients and healthcare professionals?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The measures were agreed after consultation with patients and healthcare professionals.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the patient card mentioned in the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The patient card is to emphasize the weekly dosing for inflammatory diseases to be provided with oral medicines.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What type of educational materials will be provided to healthcare professionals?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Healthcare professionals will be provided with educational materials for oral medicines and to counsel patients accordingly.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the prominent reminder on the packaging?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The prominent reminder on the packaging is to indicate how the medicine should be used for once-weekly use.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of restricting who can prescribe methotrexate-containing medicines?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Restricting who can prescribe these medicines is to ensure that only doctors with expertise in using them can do so.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the document about?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document is about an order signed by the recovery officer prohibiting certain actions related to debt, shares/deposits, and movable property.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this order?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of this order is to prohibit the creditor from recovering the debt and the debtor from making payment thereof, in the case of debt, and to prohibit certain actions related to shares/deposits and movable property.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is prohibited in the case of debt?
question_answer_pairs.answer: In the case of debt, the creditor is prohibited from recovering the debt, and the debtor is prohibited from making payment thereof.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is prohibited in the case of a share or deposit?
question_answer_pairs.answer: In the case of a share or deposit, the person in whose name the share or the deposit may be standing is prohibited from transferring the share or deposit or receiving any dividend or interest thereon.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is prohibited in the case of any other movable property?
question_answer_pairs.answer: In the case of any other movable property, the person in possession of it is prohibited from giving it over to the judgment debtor.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Where will a copy of this order be sent?
question_answer_pairs.answer: A copy of this order shall be sent to the debtor, in the case of the debt, to the proper officer of the corporation and in the case of the other movable property to the person in possession of such property.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What will the recovery officer do when the debt or deposit matures?
question_answer_pairs.answer: As soon as the debt referred to in clause (a) or the deposit referred to in clause (b) matures, the recovery officer may direct the person concerned to pay the amount to him.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What will the recovery officer do if the share is not withdrawable?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Where the share is not withdrawable, the recovery officer shall arrange for its sale through a broker.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What will the recovery officer do if the share is withdrawable?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Where the share is withdrawable, its value shall be paid to the recovery officer or to the party referred to in clause (c).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the rule regarding the sale of immovable property?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Immovable property shall not be sold in execution of a decree unless such property has been previously attached.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the rules to be observed in the attachment and sale, or sale without attachment of immovable property?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The rules specified in clause (a) and (b) shall be observed in the attachment and sale, or sale without attachment of immovable property.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What information should the application presented under sub-rule (2) contain?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The application should contain a description of the immovable property to be proceeded against, sufficient for its identification and in case such property can be identified by boundaries or numbers in a record of settlement or survey, the specification of such boundaries or numbers and the specification of the defaulter's share or interest in such property to the best of the belief of the decree-holder.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What should the demand notice issued by the recovery officer contain?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The demand notice shall contain the name of the judgment debtor, the amount due, including the expenses, if any, and the date to be paid to the person who shall serve the demand notice.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Can immovable property be sold without prior attachment?
question_answer_pairs.answer: No, immovable property shall not be sold in execution of a decree unless such property has been previously attached.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the rules specified in clause (a) and (b) regarding attachment and sale of immovable property?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of these rules is to ensure proper identification of the immovable property and to provide the necessary information to the person who shall serve the demand notice.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is prohibited from recovering the debt and making payment thereof in the case of debt?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The creditor is prohibited from recovering the debt, and the debtor is prohibited from making payment thereof.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is prohibited from transferring the share or deposit or receiving any dividend or interest thereon in the case of a share or deposit?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The person in whose name the share or the deposit may be standing is prohibited from transferring the share or deposit or receiving any dividend or interest thereon.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is prohibited from giving over the movable property to the judgment debtor in the case of any other movable property?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The person in possession of it is prohibited from giving it over to the judgment debtor.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Where will a copy of the order be sent in the case of the debt and the share or deposit?
question_answer_pairs.answer: A copy of the order shall be sent to the debtor, in the case of the debt, and to the proper officer of the corporation, in the case of the share or deposit.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Where will a copy of the order be sent in the case of other movable property?
question_answer_pairs.answer: A copy of the order shall be sent to the person in possession of such other movable property.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the title of the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The title of the document is \"Procedure for Minor Procurements\".\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the threshold for a procurement to be considered a Minor procurement?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Any procurement being made above Rs 15,000/- and upto Rs 1 lakh will fall into the category of Minor procurement.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the procedure for making Minor procurements?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The procedure for making Minor procurement is given in the document.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Will there be a bidding procedure through Procurement Committee for such Minor procurements?
question_answer_pairs.answer: No, there will be no bidding procedure through Procurement Committee for such Minor procurements.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How will Minor procurements generally be done?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Minor procurements will generally be done on grounds of emergency or any exceptional reason like item not covered / available in the list of bulk procurement or one-off ad-hoc requirement of any item(s).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Will Minor procurements be done as a matter of routine?
question_answer_pairs.answer: No, they will also not be done for splitting the powers to avoid going to IFA (if powers without IFA concurrence are available to such CFAs) or higher CFA.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What will the User / Procurement entity do when a requirement for Minor procurement emerges?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Whenever requirement for Minor procurement will emerge, the User / Procurement entity will firm up the proposal in terms of desired item, source and estimated price.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Can confirmation be taken from IFA / CFA before firming up the proposal?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Yes, confirmation can also be taken from IFA / CFA before firming up the proposal.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What documents are required to be made for processing the Minor procurement?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Only a brief proforma (format enclosed) will be put up for processing as under.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the process when dispensation is given under Para 12
question_answer_pairs.answer: The same, after filling up from Sl 1 to 8, will be put up to CFA for his approval, after deleting Sl 9 of proforma (pertaining to IFA concurrence).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What happens after CFA approves the proforma?
question_answer_pairs.answer: As soon as CFA approves / signs the proforma, a simplified / concise Supply Order (format enclosed) will be placed on the selected source.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Will a copy of Supply order be sent to the User / Procurement entity?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Yes, a copy of Supply order will also be sent by User / Procurement entity to IFA to enable them to use the data regarding item, quantity and price for future procurements of same items.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When is IFA rep (as nominated by IFA) included in Procurement Committee?
question_answer_pairs.answer: If IFA rep is included as a member in Procurement Committee, then no separate concurrence of IFA will be required.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What will happen if IFA rep is included in Procurement Committee?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Same IFA rep will allot UO number and give concurrence at Sl 9 of proforma and will forward it to CFA.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What will happen if IFA rep is not included in Procurement Committee?
question_answer_pairs.answer: If IFA rep is not included in Procurement Committee, then the proforma will be put up by Procurement Committee to IFA for giving concurrence.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What will IFA do after giving concurrence?
question_answer_pairs.answer: IFA will mark their concurrence or any advice in Sl 9 of proforma and will forward it to CFA.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the threshold for Minor procurement as per the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Any procurement being made above Rs 15,000/- and upto Rs 1 lakh will fall into the category of Minor procurement.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How many stages are involved in the procedure for Minor procurements?
question_answer_pairs.answer: There are 2 stages involved - AoN and Expenditure sanction stage will be combined as single stage.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Will there be a bidding procedure for such Minor procurements?
question_answer_pairs.answer: No, there will be no bidding procedure through Procurement Committee for such Minor procurements.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Can Minor procurements be done for splitting the powers to avoid going to higher CFA?
question_answer_pairs.answer: No, they will also not be done for splitting the powers to avoid going to IFA (if powers without IFA concurrence are available to such CFAs) or higher CFA.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the role of User / Procurement entity when a requirement for Minor procurement emerges?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Whenever requirement for Minor procurement will emerge, the User / Procurement entity will firm up the proposal in terms of desired item, source and estimated price.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What documents are required to be submitted for processing the Minor procurement?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Only a brief proforma (format enclosed) will be put up for processing.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the process when dispensation is given under Para 12
question_answer_pairs.answer: The same, after filling up from Sl 1 to 8, will be put up to CFA for his approval, after deleting Sl 9 of proforma (pertaining to IFA concurrence).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What happens after CFA approves the proforma?
question_answer_pairs.answer: As soon as CFA approves / signs the proforma, a simplified / concise Supply Order (format enclosed) will be placed on the selected source.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Will a copy of Supply order be sent to IFA?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Yes, a copy of Supply order will also be sent by User / Procurement entity to IFA to enable them to use the data regarding item, quantity and price for future procurements of same items.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When is IFA rep (as nominated by IFA) included in Procurement Committee?
question_answer_pairs.answer: If IFA rep is included as a member in Procurement Committee, then no separate concurrence of IFA will be required.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What will happen if IFA rep is included in Procurement Committee?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Same IFA rep will allot UO number and give concurrence at Sl 9 of proforma and will forward it to CFA.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What will happen if IFA rep is not included in Procurement Committee?
question_answer_pairs.answer: If IFA rep is not included in Procurement Committee, then the proforma will be put up by Procurement Committee to IFA for giving concurrence.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What will IFA do after giving concurrence?
question_answer_pairs.answer: IFA will mark their concurrence or any advice in Sl 9 of proforma and will forward it to CFA.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the title of the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The title of the document is \"Procedure for Minor Procurements\".\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the threshold for a procurement to be considered a Minor procurement?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Any procurement being made above Rs 15,000/- and upto Rs 1 lakh will fall into the category of Minor procurement.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the procedure for making Minor procurements?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The procedure for making Minor procurements is given in the document.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Is there a bidding procedure through Procurement Committee for such Minor procurements?
question_answer_pairs.answer: No, there will be no bidding procedure through Procurement Committee for such Minor procurements.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Can Minor procurements be done on grounds of emergency or exceptional reasons?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Yes, Minor procurements will generally be done on grounds of emergency or exceptional reasons like item not covered / available in the list of bulk procurement or one-off ad-hoc requirement of any item(s).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Will Minor procurements be done as a matter of routine?
question_answer_pairs.answer: No, they will also not be done for splitting the powers to avoid going to IFA (if powers without IFA concurrence are available to such CFAs) or higher CFA.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the establishment mentioned in the image?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The establishment mentioned is the A-12023/2/2023 ESTABLISHMENT, Government of India, Ministry of Earth Sciences.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Where is the establishment located?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The establishment is located at Prithvi Bhavan, Lodhi Road, New Delhi-110 003.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of the establishment's advertisement?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The subject is filling up the post of Director, National Institute of Ocean Technology (NIOT), Chennai on deputation (including short-term contract) basis.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the main aim of NIOT, Chennai?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The main aims of NIOT, Chennai are to develop reliable indigenous technology to solve various engineering problems associated with harvesting of non-living and living resources of oceans, to develop world class technologies and their applications for sustainable utilization of ocean resources, to develop a knowledge base and institutional capabilities in India for management of ocean resources and environment, and to provide competitive, value added technical services and solutions to organizations working in the oceans.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the qualifications required for the deputation (including short-term contract) post?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The required qualifications are Scientists/Officers/ possessing educational qualification as specified for direct recruitment and working at the Government of India or State Governments or Union Territory Administrations including their attached and subordinate offices or Universities or recognized research institutions or PSU or Semi Government or Statutory or Autonomous Organizations/ Government funded Research organization/ Institutes etc.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the alternative qualification for the deputation (including short-term contract) post?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The alternative qualification is holding analogous posts on regular basis in the parent cadre or department, or with 3 years 'regular' service in posts in the Pay Level 14 of Pay Matrix (Rs. 144200- 218200) in the parent cadre or department.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: According to the OM, what shall be the revised pension of pre-2006 pensioners?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The revised pension shall be lower than 50% of the sum of the minimum of pay in the pay band and the grade pay thereon corresponding to the pre-revised pay scale from which the pensioner had retired.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the date of the OM that had directed the revision of pension of pre-2006 pensioners to 50% of the minimum of pay in the pay band and grade pay?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The OM was dated 28.1.2013.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the percentage of pay band and grade pay that the revised pension was to be calculated at as per the OM dated 28.1.2013?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The revised pension was to be calculated at 50% of the minimum of pay in the pay band and the grade pay thereon.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of the office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Revision of pension of pre-2006 pensioners.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the date of the office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The office memorandum is dated the 30th July, 2015.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Which department issued this office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Ministry of Personnel, PG & Pensions, Department of Pension & Pensioners' Welfare.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Where is the office located?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The office is located at the 3rd Floor, Lok Nayak Bhawan, Khan Market, New Delhi.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the reference number of the office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The reference number is No.38/37/08-P&PW(A).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: According to the OM, what shall be the revised pension of pre-2006 pensioners?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The revised pension shall be lower than 50% of the sum of the minimum of the pay in the pay band and the grade pay thereon corresponding to the pre-revised pay scale from which the pensioner had retired.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the previous order that provided for stepping up of pension of pre-2006 pensioners?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The previous order was OM No.38/37/08-P&PW(A) dated 28.1.2013.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the outcome of the writ petitions filed by the government regarding the revision of pension of pre-2006 pensioners?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Hon'ble High Court in its common order dated 29.4.2013 noted that the DoP&PW had, in the meanwhile, issued OM No.38/37/08-P&PW(A) dated 28.1.2015 which provided for stepping up of pension of pre-2006 pensioners.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the percentage of minimum pay in the pay band and grade pay that the revised pension would be calculated at?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The revised pension would be calculated at 50% of the minimum of the pay in the pay band and the grade pay.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the date of the previous OM that calculated the revised pension at 50% of the minimum of the pay in the pay band and the grade pay?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The previous OM was dated 1.1.2006.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the outcome of the Special Leave Petitions filed against the order of the Hon'ble High Court?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Special Leave Petitions (No.16145-50/2013) filed against the order of the Hon'ble High Court have also been dismissed by the Hon'ble Supreme Court.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the name of the society that provided these suggestions to the mathematics teachers?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The APREI SOCIETY AND MPABCWREI SOCIETY, AMARAVATHI provided these suggestions.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of these suggestions?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The suggestions are to help remove examinations phobia in the minds of students and boost up their confidence level in learning the subject basics which will help to get best results and 10/10 GPA in 2019 S S C Examinations.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: According to the suggestions, what is the weightage given to the academic standards and type of questions?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The weightage is given to academic standards and type of questions only.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the requirement for covering the chapters in the question paper?
question_answer_pairs.answer: There is no fixed weightage to the content, but all chapters must be covered in each question paper.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the requirement for students to answer the questions?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Students should answer the questions as per the academic standards required.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What should the teachers do to verify the high achievers' scores?
question_answer_pairs.answer: All the teachers should verify that the high achievers are scored 20/20 in internal marks.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What information is provided in the tables shown?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The tables show the academic standard-wise and question-wise marks weightage analysis for Paper-I and Paper-II based on the model papers given by SCERT.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the percentage of marks for the PROBLEM SOLVING academic standard?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The PROBLEM SOLVING academic standard has 40% of the total marks.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the percentage of marks for the REASONING & PROOF academic standard?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The REASONING & PROOF academic standard has 20% of the total marks.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the percentage of marks for the COMMUNICATION academic standard?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The COMMUNICATION academic standard has 10% of the total marks.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the percentage of marks for the CONNECTION academic standard?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The CONNECTION academic standard has 15% of the total marks.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the percentage of marks for the REPRESENTATION & VISUALIZATION academic standard?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The REPRESENTATION & VISUALIZATION academic standard has 15% of the total marks.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How are the students divided into groups based on their SA-I marks?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The students are divided into 3 groups: First group - Less than 50% marks, Second group - 51% to 70% marks, Third group - Above 70% marks.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What should the teachers do for the third group of students (above 70% marks)?
question_answer_pairs.answer: For the third group, in the beginning of study hours, revise all the concepts for all the students.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What should the teachers allow the 3rd group students to do?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Allow the 3rd group students to practice the problems by own. Rectify all the doubts immediately asked by the students.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What should the 3rd group students practice?
question_answer_pairs.answer: They should practice chapter-wise 1 mark, 2 marks and 4 marks questions for all concepts.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What should the teachers prepare and give to the students?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Prepare chapter-wise bits and give more practice on all concepts. Practice bits by using the tips given in the material.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How can the students answer the bits quickly?
question_answer_pairs.answer: You can answer the bits quickly by using the tips especially for paper-II.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the total number of academic standards mentioned in the table?
question_answer_pairs.answer: There are 5 academic standards mentioned in the table.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Which academic standard has the highest percentage of marks?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The PROBLEM SOLVING academic standard has the highest percentage of marks at 40%.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Which academic standard has the lowest percentage of marks?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The COMMUNICATION academic standard has the lowest percentage of marks at 10%.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the total percentage of marks for the USAQ and EQ question types?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The total percentage of marks for the USAQ and EQ question types is 80%.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the total percentage of marks for the OBJECTIVE type questions?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The total percentage of marks for the OBJECTIVE type questions is 20%.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How many marks are allocated for the PROBLEM SOLVING academic standard in Paper-I?
question_answer_pairs.answer: 2 marks are allocated for the PROBLEM SOLVING academic standard in Paper-I.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How many marks are allocated for the REASONING & PROOF academic standard in Paper-II?
question_answer_pairs.answer: 4 marks are allocated for the REASONING & PROOF academic standard in Paper-II.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How many marks are allocated for the COMMUNICATION academic standard in Paper-I?
question_answer_pairs.answer: 2 marks are allocated for the COMMUNICATION academic standard in Paper-I.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How many marks are allocated for the CONNECTION academic standard in Paper-I and Paper-II?
question_answer_pairs.answer: 4 marks are allocated for the CONNECTION academic standard in Paper-I and Paper-II.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How many marks are allocated for the REPRESENTATION & VISUALIZATION academic standard in Paper-II?
question_answer_pairs.answer: 4 marks are allocated for the REPRESENTATION & VISUALIZATION academic standard in Paper-II.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the total number of marks allocated across all academic standards in Paper-I and Paper-II?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The total number of marks allocated across all academic standards in Paper-I and Paper-II is 40.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What can LPG consumers approach banks directly for?
question_answer_pairs.answer: LPG consumers can approach banks directly to have their LPG consumer ID captured by banks at the bank branches against the bank account.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What information will be electronically sent by banks to OMCs?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The pair of LPG consumer ID details and bank account information will be electronically sent by banks to OMCs.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the mechanism to seed LPG consumer ID against the bank account number at bank branches?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The mechanism to seed LPG consumer ID against the bank account number at bank branches is an important alternative mechanism.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When was this mechanism rolled out in as many branches as feasible prior to scheme launch?
question_answer_pairs.answer: This mechanism was rolled out in as many branches as feasible prior to the scheme launch on 15.11.2014.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: By what date were most banks expected to roll out this mechanism?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Most banks were expected to roll out this mechanism by 1.1.2015.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is an alternative method for verification of bank details submitted by the OMCs?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Verification of bank details submitted by the OMCs via NPCI is an alternative method that may also be rolled out prior to scheme launch.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: On what date was the Video Conference with banks held to discuss this approach?
question_answer_pairs.answer: This approach was also discussed in the Video Conference of 28.10.2014 with banks.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is requested to be ensured by the banks for the smooth re-launch of the modified DBTL?
question_answer_pairs.answer: It is requested to ensure the preparedness of the banks, particularly in the 54 districts, for the smooth re-launch of the modified DBTL.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Where should the action taken be reported?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Action taken may be reported at missionfi@nic.in and fi-dfs@nic.in.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: By what date should the readiness be ensured?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The readiness may be ensured by 05.11.2014.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the title of the document shown in the image?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The title of the document is \"Code of Conduct for ZERO Tolerance of Sexual harassment to be strictly enforced and displayed prominently in all organizations.\"\n\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of the document is to establish a code of conduct for zero tolerance of sexual harassment in organizations.\n\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the first point mentioned under \"men are aware of appropriate patterns of behaviour\"?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The first point mentions that in Indian society, there is no free inter-mingling of the opposite sexes, and for the first time they interact at the workplace.\n\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the second point mentioned under \"men are aware of appropriate patterns of behaviour\"?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The second point states that it is important for men to not only know what is appropriate behavior, but also understand the fact that \"gender is not a difference in nature but a hierarchy of power\" and \"sexual harassment relates to discrimination\".\n\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the first best practice mentioned that organizations/banks/PSUs should follow?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Periodically communicating information regarding sexual harassment to all employees.\n\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the second best practice mentioned that organizations/banks/PSUs should follow?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Ensuring employees are aware that sexual harassment will not be tolerated.\n\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the third best practice mentioned that organizations/banks/PSUs should follow?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Encouraging employees to report sexual harassment.\n\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the requirement mentioned regarding sexual harassment training during induction, prior to joining?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Sexual harassment training be made mandatory during induction, prior to joining.\n\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: Ensure that employees are aware of the process for reporting sexual harassment complaints.\n\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the second point mentioned under \"Ensure that employees are aware of the process for reporting sexual harassment complaints\"?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Requirement of completion of sexual harassment training to be made mandatory during induction, prior to joining.\n\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the first point mentioned under \"In order to bring uniformity the definition of Sexual harassment and punishment to perpetrators\"?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Major penalty, penalty for first time offence/repeated offence etc. to be clearly defined in Service Regulations where not already included.\n\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the second point mentioned under \"In order to bring uniformity the definition of Sexual harassment and punishment to perpetrators\"?
question_answer_pairs.answer: And organisations to take disciplinary action against anyone indulging in sexual harassment in any form on some pretext or the other.\n\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the main topic discussed in the passage?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The passage discusses the circular nature of the universe and the concept of reincarnation.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular nature of the universe is seen as a reflection of the cycle of birth, death, and rebirth.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The passage suggests that the individual is interconnected with the larger cosmic cycle of the universe.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The passage indicates that karma plays a crucial role in the cycle of rebirth and reincarnation.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How does the passage explain the concept of moksha or liberation?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The passage suggests that moksha or liberation from the cycle of rebirth can be achieved through spiritual understanding and enlightenment.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The passage references the Vedic tradition as the source of the ideas about the circular nature of the universe and reincarnation.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The passage implies that the individual is connected to the divine or cosmic forces that govern the cycle of rebirth.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The passage indicates that time is seen as cyclical rather than linear in the circular view of the universe.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The passage cites the Bhagavad Gita as a source of the ideas about the circular nature of existence and reincarnation.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The passage describes Samsara as the continuous cycle of birth, death, and rebirth that individuals are trapped in until they achieve moksha or liberation.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the name of the post and scale of pay?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The name of the post is Assistant Section Officer, and the scale of pay is Pay matrix level -06.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the number of vacancies?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The number of vacancy is 01(One).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the eligibility/qualification criteria for the post?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The eligibility/qualification criteria include: Officers from the Central Government holding analogous posts on regular basis in the parent cadre/department; OR with three years of regular service in the Pay Matrix Level 5; OR with five years of regular service in the Pay Matrix Level 4; OR with seven years of regular service in the Pay Matrix Level 3; Officers from State Government/ Public Sector Undertaking/ Autonomous Organization holding regular post in corresponding grades with requisite experience. Desirable qualifications include experience of work in Administration/ Legal/ Establishment/ Human Resource/ Finance/ Accounts/ Budgeting / Vigilance/ Procurement/ Planning and Policy / Project implementation and monitoring/ E-Governance etc., and basic skills for working in a computerized office environment.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the age limit for the post?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The age limit for the post is that the candidate should be below 56 years of age as on the closing date of the application.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the period and other terms and conditions of deputation?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The period of deputation shall be for five years. The lending department may relieve an officer for a lesser period as per their own policy/rules, which should not be less than three years in any case. The general terms and conditions of services as LIDA will be governed as per Unique Identification Authority of India (Appointment of Officers and employees) Regulations, 2020 and other instructions issued in this regard. The terms of deputation, including the pay and allowances, except leave shall be governed by the provisions laid down in the Department of Personnel & Training Office Memorandum No. 6/8/2009-Estt.(Pay II) dated 17 June 2010 and other orders/guidelines issued in this regard from time to time.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who can apply for the post?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Eligible and willing candidates may apply through proper channel in prescribed format - Annexure I. Cadre authorities/Head of Departments are requested to forward applications of eligible and willing candidates whose services can be spared on deputation immediately on their selection.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What documents are required to be submitted along with the application?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The applications of only such officers would be considered that are routed through proper channel and are accompanied by following documents: i. Application in prescribed proforma - Annexure I, ii. Cadre Clearance Certificate from the Controlling Authority, iii. Statement giving detail of Major/Minor penalties, imposed upon the Officer, if any.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the minimum regular service required for the post?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The minimum regular service required for the post is three years in the Pay Matrix Level 5, or five years in the Pay Matrix Level 4, or seven years in the Pay Matrix Level 3.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the maximum age limit for the post?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The maximum age limit for the post is 56 years as on the closing date of the application.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the desirable qualifications for the post?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The desirable qualifications include experience of work in Administration/ Legal/ Establishment/ Human Resource/ Finance/ Accounts/ Budgeting / Vigilance/ Procurement/ Planning and Policy / Project implementation and monitoring/ E-Governance etc., and basic skills for working in a computerized office environment.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the period of deputation for the post?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The period of deputation shall be for five years. The lending department may relieve an officer for a lesser period as per their own policy/rules, which should not be less than three years in any case.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the general terms and conditions of services as LIDA?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The general terms and conditions of services as LIDA will be governed as per Unique Identification Authority of India (Appointment of Officers and employees) Regulations, 2020 and other instructions issued in this regard.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the pay and allowances during the deputation period?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The terms of deputation, including the pay and allowances, except leave shall be governed by the provisions laid down in the Department of Personnel & Training Office Memorandum No. 6/8/2009-Estt.(Pay II) dated 17 June 2010 and other orders/guidelines issued in this regard from time to time.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who can forward the applications of eligible candidates?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Cadre authorities/Head of Departments are requested to forward applications of eligible and willing candidates whose services can be spared on deputation immediately on their selection.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: Eligible and willing candidate may apply through proper channel in prescribed format - Annexure I.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The applications of only such officers would be considered that are routed through proper channel and are accompanied by: i. Statement giving detail of Major/Minor penalties, imposed upon the Officer, if any.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The minimum regular service required in the Pay Matrix Level 5 is three years.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the minimum regular service required in the Pay Matrix Level 4?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The minimum regular service required in the Pay Matrix Level 4 is five years.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the minimum regular service required in the Pay Matrix Level 3?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The minimum regular service required in the Pay Matrix Level 3 is seven years.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: Officers from State Government/ Public Sector Undertaking/ Autonomous Organization holding regular post in corresponding grades with requisite experience are eligible.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the desirable work experiences for the post?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The desirable work experiences include experience of work in Administration/ Legal/ Establishment/ Human Resource/ Finance/ Accounts/ Budgeting / Vigilance/ Procurement/ Planning and Policy / Project implementation and monitoring/ E-Governance etc.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The basic skills required for the post include skills for working in a computerized office environment.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Can Central Government Employees completing 05 years of service apply for the post?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Yes, Central Government Employee completing 05 years of service may also apply for these posts.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the prescribed format for application?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The application should be in the prescribed format - Annexure I.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What other documents are required along with the application?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Along with the application, Cadre Clearance Certificate from the Controlling Authority and Statement giving detail of Major/Minor penalties, imposed upon the Officer, if any, are required.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Can the lending department relieve the officer for a period less than 5 years?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Yes, the lending department may relieve an officer for a lesser period as per their own policy/rules, which should not be less than three years in any case.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the general terms and conditions of services as per LIDA Regulations 2020?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The general terms and conditions of services as LIDA will be governed as per Unique Identification Authority of India (Appointment of Officers and employees) Regulations, 2020 and other instructions issued in this regard.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the leave entitlement during the deputation period?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The terms of deputation, including the leave, shall be governed by the provisions laid down in the Department of Personnel & Training Office Memorandum No. 6/8/2009-Estt.(Pay II) dated 17 June 2010 and other orders/guidelines issued in this regard from time to time.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Can the applications be forwarded directly by the eligible and willing candidates?
question_answer_pairs.answer: No, the applications of only such officers would be considered that are routed through proper channel.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the name of the post and scale of pay?
question_answer_pairs.answer: - Assistant Section Officer, Pay matrix level -06\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the number of vacancies?
question_answer_pairs.answer: - 01(One)\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the eligibility/qualification criteria for the post?
question_answer_pairs.answer: - Essential: Officers from the Central Government holding analogous posts on regular basis in the parent cadre/department; OR With three years of regular service in the Pay Matrix Level 5; OR With five years of regular service in the Pay Matrix Level 4; OR With seven years of regular service in the Pay Matrix Level 3; OR Officers from State Government/ Public Sector Undertaking/ Autonomous Organization holding regular post in corresponding grades with requisite experience. Desirable: (i) Experience of work in Administration/ Legal/ Establishment/ Human Resource/ Finance/ Accounts/ Budgeting / Vigilance/ Procurement/ Planning and Policy / Project implementation and monitoring/ E-Governance etc. (ii) Basic skills for working in a computerized office environment.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the age limit for the post?
question_answer_pairs.answer: - Age Limit: for post mentioned above, the candidate should be below 56 years of age as on the closing date of the application.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the period and other terms and conditions of deputation?
question_answer_pairs.answer: - The period of deputation shall be of five years. The lending department may relieve an officer for a lesser period as per their own policy/rules, which should not be less than three years in any case.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How will the general terms and conditions of services at UIDAI be governed?
question_answer_pairs.answer: - The general terms and conditions of services at UIDAI will be governed as per the Unique Identification Authority of India (Appointment of Officers and employees) Regulations, 2020 and other instructions issued by UIDAI in this regard. The aforesaid regulations are available on the website of UIDAI (www.uidai.gov.in).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How will the terms of deputation, including the pay and allowances, be governed?
question_answer_pairs.answer: - The terms of deputation, including the pay and allowances, except leave shall be governed by the provisions laid down in the Department of Personnel & Training Office Memorandum No. 6/8/2009-Estt.(Pay II) dated 17 June 2010 and other orders/guidelines issued in this regard from time to time. Leave of an officer on deputation shall be regulated by leave rule of UIDAI.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who can apply for the eligible and willing candidate?
question_answer_pairs.answer: - Eligible and willing candidate may apply through proper channel in prescribed format – Annexure I. Cadre authorities/Head of Departments are requested to forward applications of eligible and willing candidates whose services can be spared on deputation immediately on their selection.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What documents are required to be submitted along with the application?
question_answer_pairs.answer: - i. Application in prescribed proforma – Annexure I. ii. Cadre Clearance Certificate from the Controlling Authority iii. Statement giving detail of Major/Minor penalties, imposed upon the Officer, if any.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the eligibility criteria for Central Government Employees completing 05 years of service?
question_answer_pairs.answer: - Central Government Employee completing 05 years of service may also apply for these posts.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the essential qualification for the post?
question_answer_pairs.answer: - Officers from the Central Government holding analogous posts on regular basis in the parent cadre/department.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the status of ISTM according to the image?
question_answer_pairs.answer: ISTM is an \"Attached Office\" under the Department of Personnel & Training, Government of India.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the Head of the Institute according to the image?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Head of the Institute is \"Director\", who is an officer of the level of Joint Secretary to the Government of India.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the sanctioned strength of Faculty Members at ISTM?
question_answer_pairs.answer: ISTM has a sanctioned strength of 29 Faculty Members drawn from various Central Services.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What kind of library does ISTM have?
question_answer_pairs.answer: ISTM has a Library with more than 17,450 books besides a modest video collection.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What kind of computer facilities does ISTM have?
question_answer_pairs.answer: ISTM has four well-furnished computer laboratories equipped with 135 computers with internet facility.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What kind of training material has ISTM built up?
question_answer_pairs.answer: ISTM has built up a rich reservoir of training material for distribution to its course participants.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What kind of hostel facility does ISTM have?
question_answer_pairs.answer: ISTM has a modest hostel facility, where participants are provided with twin sharing accommodation on payment of prescribed charges.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Where is ISTM located?
question_answer_pairs.answer: ISTM is located in Old JNU Campus, Opposite Sector-III, R.K. Puram, New Delhi.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How far is ISTM from New Delhi Railway Station and Indira Gandhi International Airport?
question_answer_pairs.answer: ISTM is about 15 Kms. from New Delhi Railway Station and 12 Kms from Indira Gandhi International Airport.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How many in-house courses has ISTM planned this year?
question_answer_pairs.answer: This year, ISTM has planned 230 in-house courses including 78 mid-career training programmes.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the details of the training programmes under CSS Cadre Training Plan?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The details of these courses are available in the succeeding pages.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Where can one find the details of the training calendar?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The training calendar is also available on our website: www.istm.gov.in.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the procedure followed for nominations to Assistant Section Officer (Direct Recruit) and Level A to F training programmes?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Nominations of eligible officers are made by CS Division, DoPT. These courses are not open for other participants.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the title of the training program mentioned in the image?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The title of the training program is \"Training of Trainers Programme on WTO and International Trade: Strengthening State-Centre Linkages\".\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Where is the training program being held?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The training program is being held at the Centre for WTO Studies, IIFT (New Delhi).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the dates of the training program?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The training program is scheduled for 22-23 August 2012.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the inaugural session?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of the inaugural session is to discuss why state governments should be interested in international trade and WTO issues.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the topic of Technical Session 1?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The topic of Technical Session 1 is \"Why should State Governments be interested in international trade and WTO issues: An overview (impact of international trade on states, providing inputs to DoC for trade negotiations, organizing stakeholder consultations, complying with WTO obligations, taking benefit of rights under WTO, preparing export strategy for states)\".\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of Technical Session 2?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of Technical Session 2 is to discuss the \"Institutional mechanism in the States for addressing issues related to international trade (interactive session in which participants share information about their respective states)\".\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the topic of Technical Session 3?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The topic of Technical Session 3 is \"Specific initiatives taken by State Governments to promote exports (Interactive session in which participants share information about their respective states)\".\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the tea break?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of the tea break is to allow participants to network and discuss the topics covered in the previous sessions.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the topic of Technical Session 4?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The topic of Technical Session 4 is \"Roadmap for preparing export strategy for the State (Diagnostic study for identifying export potential, mapping trade-related infrastructure in the State, action matrix for addressing constraints)\".\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of Technical Session 5?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of Technical Session 5 is to discuss \"Stakeholder consultations: Role of State Governments in creating effective channels of communication (Importance of stakeholder consultations, creating database of product-level associations, preparation of background paper, capturing stakeholder feedback, report and preparing inputs for DoC)\".\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the duration of the lunch break?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The lunch break is scheduled from 1:00 pm to 2:00 pm.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the duration of Technical Session 3?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Technical Session 3 is scheduled from 2:00 pm to 3:15 pm.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the duration of the tea break?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The tea break is scheduled from 3:15 pm to 3:30 pm.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the duration of Technical Session 4?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Technical Session 4 is scheduled from 3:30 pm to 4:45 pm.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the duration of Technical Session 5?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Technical Session 5 is scheduled from 4:45 pm to 5:45 pm.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the inaugural session?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of the inaugural session is to discuss why state governments should be interested in international trade and WTO issues.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the interactive sessions?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The interactive sessions are meant for participants to share information about their respective states.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the diagnostic study mentioned in Technical Session 4?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of the diagnostic study is to identify export potential, map trade-related infrastructure in the state, and identify action matrix for addressing constraints.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of stakeholder consultations mentioned in Technical Session 5?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of stakeholder consultations is to create effective channels of communication, capture stakeholder feedback, and prepare inputs for the Department of Commerce.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of creating a database of product-level associations mentioned in Technical Session 5?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of creating this database is to facilitate effective communication between the state governments and the relevant stakeholders.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of preparing a background paper mentioned in Technical Session 5?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of the background paper is to capture the key points and feedback from the stakeholder consultations.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the report mentioned in Technical Session 5?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of the report is to summarize the inputs and feedback gathered from the stakeholder consultations.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the inputs for the Department of Commerce mentioned in Technical Session 5?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of these inputs is to provide the Department of Commerce with the necessary information and feedback gathered from the stakeholder consultations.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The registration session is scheduled from 9:30 am to 9:50 am.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The inaugural session is scheduled from 10:00 am to 10:45 am.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: Technical Session 1 is scheduled from 10:45 am to 12 noon.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: Technical Session 2 is scheduled from 12 noon to 1:00 pm.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The tea break is scheduled from 3:15 pm to 3:30 pm.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The training program is scheduled for two days, from 22-23 August 2012.\n

What is the consequence if the candidate fails to produce any of the required certificates?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The candidate's candidature will be rejected without any further correspondence.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What will be taken as final according to the general instructions?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The particulars furnished by the applicant in the application form submitted through online will be taken as final.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Will T.A. and D.A. be paid to the candidates who appear for the Technical Examination or for verification of original certificates or for the Viva-voce?
question_answer_pairs.answer: No, T.A. and D.A. will not be paid to the candidates who appear for the Technical Examination or for verification of original certificates or for the Viva-voce.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Will the minimum qualifying marks in the Technical Examination give any vested right to any candidate to be selected?
question_answer_pairs.answer: No, the minimum qualifying marks in the Technical Examination will not give any vested right to any candidate to be selected.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What rights are reserved with the appointing authority?
question_answer_pairs.answer: All rights are reserved with the appointing authority to reject the application at any stage, if the claim is found to be false and the appointment shall liable to be cancelled if any information therein is found to be false at any later stage.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What will happen if the candidate furnishes wrong information with regard to category and caste?
question_answer_pairs.answer: If the candidate furnishes wrong information with regard to category and caste, they shall not have any right subsequently for selection in that particular category, caste etc., and in that aspect the selection authority is not responsible for the lapse on the part of the candidate.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: As per which rules will the selection be made?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Selection will be made as per the Service Rules of the High Court for the State of Telangana, 2019 (as amended from time to time).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What will happen to candidates resorting to bring any influence of any kind?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Candidates resorting to bring any influence of any kind will be summarily disqualified.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who shall not be eligible for appointment by direct recruitment?
question_answer_pairs.answer: No person who has more than one wife living or who has spouse living, in any case, in which such marriage is void by reason of its taking place during the lifetime of such spouse, shall be eligible for appointment by direct recruitment.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who shall not be eligible for appointment by direct recruitment?
question_answer_pairs.answer: No female candidate whose marriage is void by reason of the husband having a wife living at the time of such marriage or who has married a person who has a wife living at the time of such marriage, shall be eligible for appointment by direct recruitment.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who shall not be eligible for appointment to the post?
question_answer_pairs.answer: No person who has been dismissed from a State or Central Government service or from the service of Central or State Government undertaking or local or other authorities or who has been convicted by a Court of Law for an offence involving moral turpitude shall be eligible for appointment to the post.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How will the appointment be covered?
question_answer_pairs.answer: This appointment shall be covered by the Contributory Pension Scheme (CPS).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Will any information be sent to the unsuccessful candidates after the selection process?
question_answer_pairs.answer: No information will be sent to the unsuccessful candidates after the selection process.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the final status of the particulars furnished by the applicant in the application form?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The particulars furnished by the applicant in the application form submitted through online will be taken as final.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the consequence if the claim is found to be false?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The appointment shall liable to be cancelled if any information therein is found to be false at any later stage.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the responsibility of the selection authority regarding the lapse on the part of the candidate?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The selection authority is not responsible for the lapse on the part of the candidate if the candidate furnishes wrong information with regard to category and caste.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the time period for which the Service Rules of the High Court for the State of Telangana, 2019 are applicable?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Service Rules of the High Court for the State of Telangana, 2019 are applicable (as amended from time to time).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the consequence for candidates resorting to bring any influence of any kind?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Candidates resorting to bring any influence of any kind will be summarily disqualified.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the marital status requirement for eligibility for direct recruitment?
question_answer_pairs.answer: No person who has more than one wife living or who has spouse living, in any case, in which such marriage is void by reason of its taking place during the lifetime of such spouse, shall be eligible for appointment by direct recruitment.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the marital status requirement for female candidates for eligibility for direct recruitment?
question_answer_pairs.answer: No female candidate whose marriage is void by reason of the husband having a wife living at the time of such marriage or who has married a person who has a wife living at the time of such marriage, shall be eligible for appointment by direct recruitment.
